alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:04PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Weld, northeastern Denver and northwestern Adams Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 204 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado near Platteville, or 17 miles south of Greeley, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Aurora, northeastern Commerce City, Brighton, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Fort Lupton, Lochbuie, Platteville, Hudson, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
